instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A2337: What is A2337? A2337 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Air from years Late 2020 M1 with EMC 3598, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-02016..
definitions.820-02016: What is 820-02016? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: MBA <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2337</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Freezing Behavior
threads.message:
MBA <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2337</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>

If you turn it on it works perfectly. However if you close the lid and open again keyboard and trackpad do not work anymore you need to RESTART machine for it to work again.

If you plug a USB mouse it will work even if the trackpad is NOT WORKING

Any ideas about this issue?

threads.title: MBA <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2337</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Freezing Behavior
threads.message:
Very likely Hall sensor issue.
Disconnect JR850 and check if changes.
If still same, try disconnecting RIO flex.

threads.title: MBA <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2337</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Freezing Behavior
threads.message:
Just download some files related to <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02016</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> which seems to be the board related to this model (<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2337</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>) since I didnt dissamble it.

However it contains a .BVR file which does not open in OPENBOARDVIEW.

How to open it? I am not into paid software for it

threads.title: MBA <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2337</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Freezing Behavior
threads.message:
Yeah disconnected it and it seems to be fine.

However how to properly fix it?

threads.title: MBA <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2337</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Freezing Behavior
threads.message:
Tried with JR850 disconnected and if it sleep and goes back work but if it sleep and I left it for a while without usage keyboard and trackpad will not work

I am not sure if I did the right thing with this RIO flex but with it turned on and already frozen I unplugged the big flex on that small board which I think is the RIO connector since there is nothing about it on the board view but still same issue

Am I doing it on the wrong connector?

That small board seems to be 3 connectors

1 for speaker
1 I GUESS for Touch ID
1 I guess the RIO connector

threads.title: MBA <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2337</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Freezing Behavior
threads.message:
You must disconnect it before power on.
Never move any connector with machine turned on!

threads.title: MBA <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2337</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Freezing Behavior
threads.message:

But can you guide me on which one is exactly the RIO connector? Is the old I mentioned above?

threads.message:
By the way

The one I told you

I am sure I am thinking about wrong one

Which one is the RIO connector?

threads.title: MBA <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2337</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Freezing Behavior
threads.message:
Actually I think I am disconnecting the right connector

The big one on the small board

WITH the battery disconnected

But openning the LID and pressing power DOES NOT make the machine turn on AT ALL

threads.title: MBA <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2337</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Freezing Behavior
threads.message:
Once touch ID is disconnected, why do you expect to react?

Machine should automatically turn on connecting the charger.
Pressing any key should have same effect also.

In fact you must check <SIGNAL>AMR_LEFT</SIGNAL>/<SIGNAL>RIGHT_OR_ND_1V8</SIGNAL> signals behavior, with lid close/open.
If any stays always low, there is the problem.
Disconnecting the mentioned connectors, corresponding signal should be always high.

threads.title: MBA <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2337</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Freezing Behavior
threads.message:
Using the charger I could turn it on

without RIO and JR850 connected its working fine

How to properly fix this issue from now?

threads.title: MBA <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2337</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Freezing Behavior
threads.message:
Using the charger machine turned on

With both RIO and JR850 disconnected

However SAME 

You close the lid wait for some minutes and keyboard and trackpad does not work

threads.title: MBA <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2337</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Freezing Behavior
threads.message:
"Tried with JR850 disconnected and if it sleep and goes back work but if it sleep and I left it for a while without usage keyboard and trackpad will not work"
Is this still valid?
Reconnect RIO board for test.

The best option is to check UR200 signals; especially when the problem appears.

<SIGNAL>AMR_RIGHT_OR_ND_1V8</SIGNAL> = I didnt disamble the board at atll. Is there a way to check it without dissambleor the LEFT measurement already means something since its below 1.8v?

threads.title: MBA <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2337</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Freezing Behavior
threads.message: 1.57V is OK...

threads.title: MBA <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2337</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Freezing Behavior
threads.message: And then what is next to do with the goal in mind to fix this board??

threads.title: MBA <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2337</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Freezing Behavior
threads.message:
Save data and do DFU restore.

KB/TP worked for short time after coming back from sleep even before disconnecting JR850?

threads.title: MBA <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2337</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Freezing Behavior
threads.message:
KB/TP worked for short time after coming back from sleep even before disconnecting JR850? 

Yes

If you click for the machine to sleep and instantly use the KB/TP it will work

BUT

If you wait for 5-10 min it will not work anymore

threads.title: MBA <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2337</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Freezing Behavior
threads.message:
Then shouldn't be Hall sensors issue.
Unless some of them is not stable in time.
To discard 100%, you should check the 3 signals when problem appears.

TP/KB work perfect in time before going to sleep?

Don't forget about DFU...

threads.title: MBA <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2337</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Freezing Behavior
threads.message:
The machine works perfectly until it goes for sleep for 5-10 minutes then when I wake the screen appears and KB/TP do not work at all, BUT If I plug a USB mouse the USB mouse works normal while the KB/TP still not working.

Should I go for DFU restore? Should I do the DFU restore with any flex disconnected or no?

Which 3 SIGNALS are you talking about?

threads.title: MBA <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2337</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Freezing Behavior
threads.message:
"Which 3 SIGNALS are you talking about?
...........................
The best option is to check UR200 signals; especially when the problem appears."

But may be not related.
I'm not sure if problem appears only when you close/open the lid, or even if macOS goes to sleep by itself; through software I mean.

<SIGNAL>IPD_LID_OPEN_1V8</SIGNAL> goes to trackpad and must be high to enable it.
Also keyboard doesn't work if something goes wrong with trackpad.

threads.title: MBA <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2337</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Freezing Behavior
threads.message:
DFU restored solved it!

Thank you so much!!

For some reason it worked different after doing DFU restore (kinda of crazy worked out good) but after a day its doing the same thing!

I did again DFU restore and right after install it. I closed the lid and opened instantly it even did not enter the password screen it still at the desktop screen and it totally freeze mouse and keyboard!

threads.title: MBA <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2337</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Freezing Behavior

threads.title: MBA <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2337</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Freezing Behavior
threads.message:
Then AMR right sensor should be the problem.
You didn't specify the voltage with JE900 connected...

threads.title: MBA <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2337</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Freezing Behavior
threads.message:
How can I measure  <SIGNAL>AMR_RIGHT_OR_ND_1V8</SIGNAL>  with JE900 connected and the board assembled? Is there a way? Looking at the schematics the only point would be RR201 which is on the back side of the assemble board.

The only option is dissamble everything?  Is there a way to measure without dissamble?

threads.title: MBA <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2337</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Freezing Behavior
threads.message:
Try to isolate its trace from JE900.
Left right sensor is sufficient, if machine works good without right one.
The pull-up resistor is on the MLB (RR201); no need to keep the sensor connected.

threads.title: MBA <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2337</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Freezing Behavior
threads.message:
I did not understand. What do you mean by isolate the trace?

JE900 is below the board I didnt disconnect it on JE900

I disconnected it on the small board which have the audio jack and I am not sure the position of this trace on that small board since I only have schematic of the main logic board.

Yes machine works fine with the other side of JE900 disconnected 
Yes RR201 is on the main board and also on the side that is NOT accessible with the board connected

threads.title: MBA <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2337</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Freezing Behavior
threads.message: Either change the AMR sensor, or remove the MLB and cut off its trace somewhere, if possible.

threads.title: MBA <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2337</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Freezing Behavior
threads.message:
Why you never explain in detail?
Which component is the AMR sensor? I am not sure since I never touch this newer board model
Sorry for being a beginner and need your help

threads.title: MBA <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2337</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Freezing Behavior
threads.message:
I am thinking is easier and cheaper to cut off the trace somewhere.
Is it possible? If so how to do it on this board?

threads.title: MBA <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2337</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Freezing Behavior
threads.message:
Close to UR200, I suppose.
Be aware, maintain RR201 connected to its pin 1!

threads.title: MBA <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2337</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Freezing Behavior
threads.message: If I only remove the connection of RR201 from pin 2 and keep it soldered to pin 1 would make to your solution?

threads.title: MBA <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2337</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Freezing Behavior
threads.message: I meant to keep RR201 connected to pin1 of UR200...

threads.title: MBA <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2337</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Freezing Behavior
threads.message:
Can you explain me with more details detail what to do? 

I kind of keep asking you, and you give me shallow information of what to do, usually a tiny sentence then I need to come here and make the almost the same question again.

I am deeply sorry to have less knowledge than you in this area and come here to ask you. 

But that's how I repair some boards and it helps me make a living.

RR201 is by default connected to pin 1of UR200 according to the image

threads.title: MBA <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2337</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Freezing Behavior
threads.message:
You must cut off the trace for <SIGNAL>AMR_RIGHT_OR_ND_1V8</SIGNAL>, maintaining RR201 connected to UR200.
Do NOT cut between RR201 and UR200!
So find a convenient point to do this.
Just need to interrupt the connection with JE900.

threads.title: MBA <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2337</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Freezing Behavior
threads.message:
PERFECT! I understood 100%

Since you have more knowledge than me with newer boards 

Do you have a suggestion for this convenient point? Lifting the PIN 10 on JE900 would be convenient and safe? Is there a better option?

threads.title: MBA <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2337</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Freezing Behavior
threads.message:
Best option, cut the trace.
Do not damage the connector; in case you decide to change AMR sensor in the future.
I don't have the board in front, to follow that trace...

threads.title: MBA <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2337</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Freezing Behavior
threads.message:
OK

Board out of the case

We have a TP before going to the JE900 on the board itself. 

Should I use the knife blade and CUT the surface of it as I am pointing in the picture attached?

A bit afraid to damage anything

A small cut would work?

threads.title: MBA <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2337</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Freezing Behavior
threads.message:
There is good to cut the small trace.
Be aware, do not damage that "test point"; there is where the trace goes inside the MLB.
Is not a pure test point.
Not a big problem however, if will not replace the affected AMR sensor in the future.

threads.title: MBA <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2337</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Freezing Behavior
threads.message:
Done.

Cut a bit of it and now it seems to be 100% working 

Just noticed if I close the lid without locking the screen and open again after a few minutes it still UNLOCKED.

Did the RIGHT AMR sensor would be responsible for automatically locking the machine when closing the lid?
